trans-unit.source: Represents a mutable reference type that wraps either a <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes.Buffer"></xref> or a <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes.Stream"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> class based on the specified byte array.
If a null reference is passed in, the instance is set to null.
The array of unsigned bytes.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> class based on the specified <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBinary"></xref> value.
If a null reference is passed in, the instance is set to null.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBinary"></xref> value.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> class based on the specified <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> value.
If a null reference is passed in, the instance is set to null.
A <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
Returns a reference to the internal buffer.
Returns a null reference for null value <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes>.
Throws an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> for stream-wrapped instances of <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes>.
Returns a reference to the internal buffer.
For <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> instances created on top of unmanaged pointers, it returns a managed copy of the internal buffer.
Returns the XML Schema definition language (XSD) of the specified <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSet"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSet"></xref>.
A `string` that indicates the XSD of the specified `XmlSchemaSet`.
Gets a Boolean value that indicates whether this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> is null.
The default value is `false`.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> is null, `false` otherwise.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> instance at the specified index.
A <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value.
A <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> value.
Gets the length of the value that is contained in the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> instance.
The default value is 0.
A <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value representing the length of the value that is contained in the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> instance.
Returns -1 if no buffer is available to the instance or if the value is null.
Returns a <xref href="System.IO.Stream.Length"></xref> for a stream-wrapped instance.
Gets the maximum length of the value of the internal buffer of this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref>.
The default value is 0.
A long representing the maximum length of the value of the internal buffer.
Returns -1 for a stream-wrapped <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref>.
Returns a null instance of this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref>.
Returns an instance in such a way that <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes.IsNull"></xref> returns `true`.
Copies bytes from this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> instance to the passed-in buffer and returns the number of copied bytes.
If an attempt is made to read beyond <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes.MaxLength%2A>, an exception is thrown.
If `count` specifies more bytes to be copied than are available from the `offset` to the end of the value, only the available bytes are copied.
An exception is thrown if the destination buffer is a null reference.
An exception is thrown if the destination buffer cannot receive as many characters as requested.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> long value offset into the value that is contained in the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> instance.
The byte array buffer to copy into.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> integer offset into the buffer to start copying into.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> integer representing the number of bytes to copy.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> long value representing the number of copied bytes.
Sets the length of this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> instance.
This method will trigger an internal conversion to a managed buffer for an instance built on top of an unmanaged buffer.
The <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> long value representing the length.
Sets this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> instance to null.
Returns information about the storage state of this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> instance.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.StorageState"></xref> enumeration.
Gets or sets the data of this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> as a stream.
Getting or setting the <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes.Stream%2A> property loads all the data into memory.
Using it with large value data can cause an <xref:System.OutOfMemoryException>.
The stream that contains the SqlBytes data.
Constructs and returns a <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBinary"></xref> from this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> instance.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBinary"></xref> from this instance.
Returns a managed copy of the value held by this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref>.
Returns a null reference for null value <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes>.
The value of this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> as an array of bytes.
Copies bytes from the passed-in buffer to this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> instance.

If this operation writes to a position beyond <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes.Length%2A> but within <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes.MaxLength%2A>, <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes.Length%2A> is updated to reflect the new ending position.
The value of `offsetInBuffer` must be less than or equal to <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes.Length%2A>.
An exception is thrown otherwise.
Only a value of 0 can be specified when writing to a null value instance.
If an attempt is made to write beyond <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes.MaxLength%2A>, an exception is thrown.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> long value offset into the value that is contained in the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> instance.
The byte array buffer to copy into.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> integer offset into the buffer to start copying into.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> integer representing the number of bytes to copy.
Gets serialization information with all the data needed to reinstantiate this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes"></xref> instance.
The object to be populated with serialization information.
The destination context of the serialization.
This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
